translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The forward and reverse order of conditions in relation to mental phenomena, the text of the Paṭṭhāna according to the method of the Triads and Dyads

original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Tikadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (4)🔽16.87. Sanidassanattika, Upekkhāsahagataduka🔽Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ upekkhāsahagataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanidassanaappaṭigho naupekkhāsahagato🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ upekkhāsahagataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca🔽nasanidassanasappaṭigho naupekkhāsahagato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā …pe… anidassanaappaṭighaṁ🔽upekkhāsahagataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasanidassanasappaṭigho naupekkhāsahagato ca naanidassanasappaṭigho
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  upekkhā sahagata duka  anidassana appaṭigham upekkhā sahagatam dhammam paṭicca na anidassana appaṭighaḥ na upekkhā sahagataḥ  dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā anidassana appaṭigham upekkhā sahagatam dhammam paṭicca  na sa nidassana sa ppaṭighaḥ na upekkhā sahagataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā pe a nidassana appaṭigha  upekkhā sahagatam dhammam paṭicca na sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ na upekkhā sahagataḥ ca na a nidassana sa paṭighaḥ
translated: With the dyad on that which is visible, etc., and the dyad on equanimity

original: naupekkhāsahagato ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha, ārammaṇe🔽tīṇi …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: na aupekkhā sahagataḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha ārammaṇe 🔽tīṇi pe a vigate cha
translated: With a visible datum as condition there arises what is non-visible and not accompanied by equanimity. With a visible datum as condition there arises what is visible and not accompanied by equanimity. With a visible datum as condition there arises what is non-visible and not accompanied by equanimity and what is visible and not accompanied by equanimity. With a visible datum as condition there arises what is visible and not accompanied by equanimity and what is non-visible and not accompanied by equanimity. With a visible datum as condition there arises what is visible and not accompanied by equanimity and what is non-visible and not accompanied by equanimity and what is visible and not accompanied by equanimity. With a visible datum as condition there arises what is non-visible and not accompanied by equanimity and what is visible and not accompanied by equanimity and what is non-visible and not accompanied by equanimity. With a visible datum as condition there arises what is visible and not accompanied by equanimity and what is non-visible and not accompanied by equanimity and what is visible and not accompanied by equanimity and what is non-visible and not accompanied by equanimity. With a visible datum as condition there arise the three remaining triads in the dyad. With a visible datum as condition there arise the four remaining tetrads in the dyad. With a visible datum as condition there arise the five remaining pentads in the dyad. With a visible datum as condition there arise the six remaining hexads in the dyad. With a visible datum as condition there arise the seven remaining heptads in the dyad. With a visible datum as condition there arise the eight remaining octads in the dyad. With a visible datum as condition there arise the nine remaining nonads in the dyad. With a visible datum as condition there arise the ten remaining decades in the dyad. With a visible datum as condition there arise the eleven remaining undecades in the dyad. With a visible datum as condition there arise the twelve remaining decades in the dyad. With a visible datum as condition there arise the thirteen remaining decades in the dyad. With a visible datum as condition there arise the fourteen remaining decades in the dyad.
